org.safs.persist

Class PersistorToHierarchialString

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.persist.PersistableChecker
      • org.safs.persist.AbstractPersistor
        • org.safs.persist.PersistorToString
          • org.safs.persist.PersistorToHierarchialString
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Persistor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PersistorToJSONString, PersistorToXMLString

    public abstract class PersistorToHierarchialString
extends PersistorToString
    Write the Persistable object to a persistence of hierarchical structure, such as JSON, XML format.
    Author:
    Lei Wang

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        protected final java.lang.String parse(Persistable persistable,
                                       boolean needLeadingNameForContainer)
                                throws SAFSException
        Convert a Persistable Object to a hierarchical string. The concrete format depends on the sub-class.
        Specified by:
        parse in class PersistorToString
        Parameters:
        persistable -
        needLeadingNameForContainer -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        SAFSException

      • getTagName

        protected java.lang.String getTagName(java.lang.String className)

      • getContainerBegin

        protected abstract java.lang.String getContainerBegin(java.lang.String className,
                                                      boolean needLeadingName)
        This is called inside parse(Persistable, boolean) to write the begin of a container such as:
        • <tagNam> for XML format
        • "tagName" : {\n for JSON format
        Parameters:
        className - String, the class name of a container. This is a full class-name, which may needs to treated to get the simple class name as the tag-name.
        needLeadingName - boolean, if the leading tag name is needed. For example sometimes we don't need the "tagName" for JSON format.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getChildBegin

        protected abstract java.lang.String getChildBegin(java.lang.String key,
                                                  java.lang.String value,
                                                  java.lang.String classname)
        This is called inside parse(Persistable, boolean) to write "key" and "value" of a child.
        Parameters:
        key - String, the key name
        value - String, the value
        classname - String, the class name of this value. It is not useful with JSON format, but it is useful for XML format.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getChildEnd

        protected java.lang.String getChildEnd(boolean lastChild)
        This is called inside parse(Persistable, boolean) to write the end of a child, here a newline "\n" is written.
        Parameters:
        lastChild - boolean, if this is the last child within the container. it is useful for some file format, such as JSON, if this is false (not the last child), a comma , needs to be added at the end as "key" : "value" ,
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getContainerEnd

        protected abstract java.lang.String getContainerEnd(java.lang.String className)
        This is called inside parse(Persistable, boolean) to write the end of a container such as:
        • </tagNam> for XML file
        • } for JSON file.
        Parameters:
        className - String, the tag name, it is normally a container. This is a full class-name, which may needs to treated to get the simple class name as the tag-name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • parseFieldValue

        protected java.lang.String parseFieldValue(java.lang.Object value)
        Parse the parameter value and convert it to a string which will be persisted to (File or Variable or ...)
        The following are the ways to parse value:
        • The String value will be PersistorToString.escape(String) and double-quoted if needed.
        • The array value will be transformed into [item1, item2, item3]
        • The Number value will be returned as string without quote.
        Parameters:
        value - Object, the Persistable object field's value
        Returns:
        String, the parsed result of the field's value
        null if the parameter 'value' is null.
        Throws:
        SAFSException

      • parseArrayField

        protected java.lang.String parseArrayField(java.lang.Object arrayFieldObject)
        Parameters:
        arrayFieldObject - Object, it is the object represent an array field of a class
        Returns:
        String, the string format of an array object
